text: I've created a dropdown menu which works great, but I am having trouble getting the dropdown :after to align with its parent. For every menu item, the dropdown appears in the same spot. Any ideas without having to reconstruct this entire thing? <https://www.loom.com/share/b16b645e0ed94006a47eba476bd1c3c5>
does your .dropdown class have position:relative assigned? it looks like the after is taking its absolute position from a higher-up element
Holy smokes, that worked. Like magic!

absolute position works with the nearest relative or absolute positioned ancestor. it ignores static and fixed elements. even pseudoelements.
